content:
D. James the son of Zebedee. 
E. Peter the Apostle. 
 
38. By whom did the Lord heal the blindness of Paul? 
A. Ananias B. Cephas C. John Mark 
D. Silas E. Timothy. 
 
39. Who insisted in his speech that God does not dwell in 
houses made with hands and that it was wrong for 
Solomon to have built a house for Him? 
A. Peter. B. James. 
C. Paul. D. Matthew. 
E. Stephen. 
 
40. ‘The Holy Spirit will come upon you and the power of 
the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child 
to be born will be called holy, the Son of God’. This was 
said by the angel Gabriel to 
A. ElizabethB. Zechariah 
C Mary D. Joseph E. The Shepherds. 
 
41. ‘But I say to you that hear, love your enemies, do good 
to those who hate you, bless those who curse you, 
pray for those who abuse you’. Jesus said this 
A. on the road to Calvary. 
B. on the road to Emmaus. 
C. on the road to Jerusalem. 
D. during the Transfiguration. 
E. During the Sermon on the Mount. 
 
42. What did the Apostles do when complaints were made 
to them that some sections of the new Christian community 
were not being supplied with their needs for 
sustenance? They 
A. gave out more money for buying food. 
B. said that they had neither gold nor silver. 
C. appointed seven deacons to undertake the 
care of the new Christians. 
D. appointed the Apostles: James, Peter and John 
to oversee the supply of provisions to the 
new Christians. 
E. decided to call a council in Jerusalem to look 
into the matter. 
43. When Paul came to Rome, the first set of people to 
whom he preached were the 
A. Romans B. Jews C. Greeks 
D. Samaritans E. Corinthians. 
 
44. ‘Blessed are you among women and blessed is the fruit 
of your womb’. This was said by 
A. the angel Gabriel B. Simeon C. Anna 
D.  Elizabeth E. Zechariah. 
 
45. Jesus was led into the wilderness by 
A. the devil B. the Holy Spirit C.  Satan 
D. hunger E. the angel Gabriel. 
 
46. And he came to ... where he had been brought up; and, 
as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the 
Sabbath Day, and stood up to read. 
Identify the missing place into he above text. 
A. Jerusalem. B.    Bethlehem. C. Nazareth. 
D.   Capernaum. E. Bethany. 
 
47. ‘Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be 
of the seven for they all had her? This question was 
put to Jesus by the 
A. Pharisees. B.    Scribes. C. Chief Priests. 
D. Sadducees. E. Sanhedrin. 
48. Pilate gave Jesus to the Jews to be crucified because 
A. he found Jesus guilty of  the charges. 
B. Jesus refused to defend himself. 
C. the Jews gave him money. 
D. Jesus did not answer him. 
E. the Jews brought pressure upon him. 
 
49. Paul was converted so that he might 
A. stop persecuting the Apostles. 
B. help Peter in the work. 
C. not be killed for his sins. 
D. bear the name of the Lord before the Gentiles. 
E. see visions. 
 
50. Paul and Silas were imprisoned at 
A. Athens. B. Philippi C. Antioch 
D. Corinth  E. Ephesus. 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1984  
1. After the Flood, God allowed all food to be eaten except 
A. olive leaves. 
B. flesh with its blood in it. 
C. animals with cloven hooves. 
D. reptiles. 
E. birds of prey. 
 
2. ‘Two nations are in your womb, and two peoples, born 
of you shall be divided ...’. This was addressed by God 
to 
A. Deborah B. Miriam C. Rebekah 
D. Delilah E. Sarah. 
 
3. The wife of Moses was 
A. Esther B. Zipporah 
C. Hagar D. Michal 
E. Ruth. 
 
4. ‘... I the Lord your God am a jealous God, visiting the 
iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third 
and fourth generation of those who hate me, but 
showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love 
me and keep my commandments’. This statement was 
made by God when 
A. He gave the Ten Commandments to Moses. 
B. the Israelites disobeyed God’s 
commandments. 
C. the family of Aaron was elected to the 
priesthood.  
D. He commanded Moses to go to meet Pharaoh. 
E. the Israelites had settled in the Promised Land. 
 
5. The three sons of Noah were Shem, Ham and 
A. Lot    B.  Hirah C.  Cain D. Japheth E. Eber. 
 
6. Identify the INCORRECT option. The Israelites were 
instructed to eat the Passover
